snippet: The Israeli-Arab conflict has become a miniature of the most relevant divide in the world today.
abstract: Thomas L Friedman Op-Ed column envisions latest flare up in Israeli-Arab conflict as a miniature example of the global conflict between order and disorder; notes that it is increasingly difficult for advanced states like Israel to control nonstate actors like Hamas, who are launching rockets from Gaza; argues that the only sustainable solution is for Israel to partner with moderate Palestinians to build a thriving state in the West Bank.
lead_paragraph: The Israeli-Arab conflict has become a miniature of the most relevant divide in the world today.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
